content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Really good and easily little clash

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Love it! A fun exercise, neither too hard nor too easy, and very satisfying once completed! I also like the large numbers in the test cases that require the solution to be optimized.
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

Not a strict change, but my two cents on the wording:

Instead of:
Given a sequence "a" with length "n" and a positive integer "b"...
My suggestion:
Given a sequence "a" of space separated integers of length "n" and a positive integer "b"...

Otherwise looks good to me :)

PS: Interesting question!
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

This is a very good coding challenge. 
action suggestions made by @littlehigh22 and consider the following as well:
1. Output: 'Print one integer' may read 'Print an integer'
2. Constraints: 'where q<=i<=n' is repetition of constraint 1

Thanks

It is a good problem, my suggestion would be 
In the input section, 
Line 1: n, b separated by space where,
n: the length of sequence a 
b: positive integer that can be added to elements of sequence a in order to make it strictly increasing.

also in Line 2, you can change it to space separated sequence "a" of integers than integers "a".

Thanks
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!
hi nice exercice but I think you give so many clues to success the exercice

Goal section
* Please change "operation" to "operations" (twice).

Input section
* Please change "sequence" to "sequence of integers".

Output section
* Please change "moves" to "operations".

Constraints section
* Suggest to change the last constraint as:
1 <= a_i <= 10^6 where 1 <= i <= n

Cases
* Please add a test similar to Validator 4 (n is large and answer = 0).

* Please add a validator similar to Test 5 (n is large and sequence a contains many repeated integers).

Thanks.
